content: acc. Heidegger, sciences belong to essence of technology, not to technology—to its essence; technology remains plunged in a fog (noyée dans un brouillard) > we still do not think (science, no one, is responsible for this) > the most thought-provoking (das Bedenklichste): we still do not think ——for Heidegger, thinking as work of cabinetmaker (Schreiner), a joiner, attune to hidden plenitude of wood’s essence as it enters inhabited site, Handwerk
